contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "gained complete control over his kingdom" or "ruled powerfully over his kingdom" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was strengthened in his rule

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the bronze altar that Bezalel son of Uri son Hur made" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the bronze altar made by Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "please do what you promised to David my father that you would do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let your promise to David my father be carried out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "There were 153,600 foreigners" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-numbers]])
contextId.glQuote: They were found to be 153,600

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when the workers cast the sea itself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when the sea itself was cast

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Solomon's workers set 'The Sea' on top of the oxen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: "The Sea" was set on top of them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Solomon's workers forged the brim to look like the brim of a cup, to curve outward like a lily" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: its brim was forged like the brim of a cup, like a lily blossom

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people were to wash the items used in performing the burnt offering in them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: items used in performing the burnt offering were to be washed in them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "according to the instructions for their design" or "according to how Solomon instructed his workers to design them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that were made from the instructions for their design

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) there was so much bronze no one tried to weigh it. Alternate translation: "no one even tried to weigh the bronze" or 2) this is a hyperbole that emphasizes the great amount of bronze. Alternate translation: "no one could even determine how much all the bronze weighed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: the weight of the bronze could not be known

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the tables on which the priests were to place the bread of the presence" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the tables on which the bread of the presence was to be placed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The workers also made the lamp trimmers ... out of pure gold" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Also the lamp trimmers ... were all made of pure gold

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the workers made its inner doors ... out of gold" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: its inner doors ... were made of gold

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "poles by which the priests carried it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: poles by which it was carried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "making one sound as they praised and thanked Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: making one sound to be heard for praising and thanking Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Then a cloud filled the house of Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then the house, the house of Yahweh, was filled with a cloud

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Praise Yahweh, the God of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May Yahweh, the God of Israel, be praised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "confirm your word" or "make your word come true" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let your word be confirmed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone requires him to swear an oath" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is required to swear an oath

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When an enemy defeats your people Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When your people Israel are defeated by an enemy

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "is called by your name" shows that God possesses and owns the house. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you own this house that I have built" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: this house I have built is called by your name

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "where their enemies have taken them as exiles" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: where they have been exiled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "to the prayer that we make in this place" or "to us as we pray to you in this place" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to the prayer that is made in this place

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "to the prayers that you make in this place" or "to you as you pray to me in this place" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the prayers that are made in this place

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They completed all the work that Solomon had ordered" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: All the work ordered by Solomon was completed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "from the day they laid the foundation of the house of Yahweh" or "from the day they built the foundation of the house of Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: from the day the foundation of the house of Yahweh was laid

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "until they finished building the temple" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: until it was finished

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The house of Yahweh was complete" or "They completed building the house of Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The house of Yahweh was completed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated it active form. Alternate translation: "They did not tell me about even half of your wisdom and wealth" or "You are much more wise and wealthy than what they told me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Not half was told me about your wisdom and wealth

contextId.occurrenceNote: The verb "was ever given" can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "No one ever gave more spices than the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: No greater amount of spices ... was ever given to him again

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one had seen wood like this before in the land of Judah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: No wood like this had been seen before in the land of Judah

contextId.occurrenceNote: Silver was so common in Solomon's days that if a king wanted to show his wealth, he would not do it by making things out of silver. Instead he would use gold, which was less common and more valuable. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people did not value silver so much" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: silver was not considered valuable in Solomon's days

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "when Rehoboam had established his reign" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when Rehoboam's reign was established

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form and assumes that the answer is positive. The question is rhetorical and is used for emphasis. It can be translated as a statement. Alternate translation: "they are written ... Jeroboam." or "you can read about them ... Jeroboam." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-rquestion]])
contextId.glQuote: are they not written ... Jeroboam?

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people buried him in the city of David" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was buried in the city of David

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the army of Judah subdued the people of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the people of Israel were subdued

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "are in the history that the prophet Iddo wrote" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: are written in the history of the prophet Iddo

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for Yahweh's army completely destroyed them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for they were completely destroyed before Yahweh and his army

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you will find him" or "he will permit you to find him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he will be found by you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they found him" or "he permitted them to find him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was found by them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Yahweh is the implied subject. Alternate translation: "for Yahweh will reward your work" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: for your work will be rewarded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "should die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [2 Chronicles 15:4](../15/04.md). Alternate translation: "they found him" or "he permitted them to find him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was found by them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "But Asa did not command the people to take the high places out of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: But the high places were not taken out of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Asa had a disease in his feet" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Asa was afflicted with a disease in his feet

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that skilled perfumers had prepared" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: prepared by skilled perfumers

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The divisions by the name of their fathers' houses were as follows" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: These were their divisions listed by the name of their fathers' houses

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "until you consume them" (See:[[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: until they are consumed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone held the king of Israel up in his chariot" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the king of Israel was held up in his chariot

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Whenever your brothers who live in their cities bring you a dispute" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Whenever any dispute comes to you from your brothers who live in their cities

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he will support you" or "he will help you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be supported

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They defeated them" or "They defeated those they had ambushed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They were defeated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he did not get rid of the high places" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the high places were not taken away

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they are in ... which is in" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are written in ... which is recorded in

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The ships became ruined and" or "The ships wrecked so that" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The ships were wrecked so that

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. It is implied that people who followed her would be trying to help her. Alternate translation: "Use your sword to kill anyone who comes to help her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: anyone who follows her, let him be killed with the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they had severely wounded Joash" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Joash had been severely wounded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God greatly helped him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was greatly helped

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "As for the other matters concerning Uzziah, from first to last, the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz recorded them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The other matters concerning Uzziah, from first to last, were recorded by the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they are in the book" or "you can read of them in the book" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are written in the book

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The men whom the leaders assigned by name" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The men who were assigned by name

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone has written them in the book" or "you can read of them in the book" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are written in the book

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the priests should make a burnt offering and a sin offering for all Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that a burnt offering and a sin offering should be made for all Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "until the priests finished offering the burnt offering" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: until the burnt offering was finished

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "until they had finished the work" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: until the work was done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the priests performed the burnt offerings with the fat of the fellowship offerings" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they were performed with the fat of the fellowship offerings

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Hezekiah set the service of the house of Yahweh in order" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the service of the house of Yahweh was set in order

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the people had done the work quickly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the work had been done quickly

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God heard their voice" or "God heard what they said to him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Their voice was heard

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Hezekiah organized the priests and the Levites into groups. He assigned each priest and Levite to their duties" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Hezekiah assigned the divisions of the priests and the Levites organized by their divisions, each man assigned to his work, both the priests and the Levites

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "just as Moses wrote in the law of Yahweh" or "just as Yahweh commanded in his law" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as it was written in the law of Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can stated in active form. Alternate translation: "As soon as the people heard the command" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: As soon as the command was sent out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Hezekiah commanded the priests and Levites to prepare storerooms" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Hezekiah commanded storerooms to be prepared

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whose names were in the records" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who were listed in the records

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "to do the daily work that they were supposed to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as required by the daily schedule, to do the work in their offices and their divisions

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "there were men responsible for giving portions" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: there were men assigned by name to give portions

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "to all whose names were in the records" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to all who were listed in the records

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that he would heal Hezekiah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that he would be healed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "But Hezekiah did not act in a grateful way after Yahweh helped him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: But Hezekiah did not pay back Yahweh for the help given to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the miracle that Yahweh had performed in the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the miraculous sign that had been done in the land

contextId.occurrenceNote: These phrases can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "men have written them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are written

contextId.occurrenceNote: These phrases can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "men have written about them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are written about

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the Levites who guarded the doors had brought into the house of God all that they had gathered" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that had been brought into the house of God, that the Levites, the guards of the doors, had gathered

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "they" refers to Hilkiah and whoever was helping him. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When they brought out the money for the supervisors from" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When they brought out the money that was brought into

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that Yahweh had given to the people through Moses" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that had been given through Moses

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "everything that you entrusted to them to do" or "everything that you gave them the responsibility to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: everything that has been entrusted to them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all that is written in it" or "all that is in this book" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all that was written in it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all the curses written" or "all the curses" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all the curses that have been written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will pour out my anger" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: my anger will be poured out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will gather you to your grave" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You will be gathered to your grave

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "that Hilkiah had found" or "that they had found" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that had been found

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "that this book contained" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that were written in this book

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all who lived in Jerusalem and Benjamin" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all who were found in Jerusalem and Benjamin

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "they prepared everything they needed so they could perform the Passover" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the service was prepared

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as David, Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun the king's seer had directed them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as directed by David, Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun the king's seer

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "There had never been such a Passover celebration in Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Such a Passover celebration had never been held in Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They observed this Passover" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: This Passover was kept

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the good deeds that he did" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his good deeds done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the words" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: what is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "and men have written of all his deeds ... in the book" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: and his deeds ... are written in the book

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone has written them in the book" or "you can read of them in the book" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are written in the book
